name: Weapons, Ammunition, and Explosives
description: Policy that restricts the sale, trade, and promotion of weapons, ammunition, explosives, and related accessories. Content is evaluated based on commercial intent, non-commercial depictions, and discussion/advocacy context.

categories.name: Commercial Intent
categories.description: Content involving buy, sell, trade, donate, gift, or ask for weapons. This section takes precedence when commercial intent is present.

subcategories.name: Machine Gun Conversion Devices
subcategories.description: Content that attempts to buy, sell, trade, donate, gift or ask for machine gun conversion devices (e.g. glock switches, auto sears)

subcategories.name: 3D Printing / CAM Instructions
subcategories.description: Content that attempts to buy, sell, gift, exchange, transfer, coordinate, speak positively about, encourage the use of or provides access to 3D printing or computer-aided manufacturing instructions for firearms or firearms parts

subcategories.name: Firearms/Explosives - Brick and Mortar
subcategories.description: Sales by legitimate brick-and-mortar entities including retail businesses, websites, brands, government agencies, or private individuals sharing on their behalf

subcategories.name: Firearms/Explosives - Other Context
subcategories.description: Any attempt to buy, sell, trade, donate, gift or ask for firearms, explosives, lethal accessories, or firearm parts in non-brick-and-mortar context

subcategories.name: Bladed Items and Other Weapons
subcategories.description: Content that attempts to buy, sell, trade, coordinate, donate, gift, or ask for bladed items and other weapons that don't meet definition of firearms/explosives

subcategories.name: Product Reviews
subcategories.description: Content that speaks positively about, provides instructions to use or encourages the use of firearms, explosives, lethal accessories, firearm parts, or bladed items in product reviews

subcategories.name: Buyback/Auction/Raffle
subcategories.description: Posted in context of donating, trading in, buying back, auction or raffle by legitimate brick-and-mortar entities

categories.name: Non-Commercial Depictions
categories.description: Depictions of weapons without commercial intent in various contexts

subcategories.name: Neutral Context - No Discussion
subcategories.description: Depicts weapons in a non-violent and neutral context without discussion or advocacy (pure depiction)

subcategories.name: Neutral Context - With Discussion/Advocacy
subcategories.description: Depicts weapons in a non-violent and neutral context with discussion or advocacy

subcategories.name: Visual Threat
subcategories.description: Content that is a visual threat depicting a weapon

subcategories.name: Weapon Pointed at Viewer/Person
subcategories.description: Imagery depicting weapons being pointed at the viewer or another person, or weapons being used in violent death, life threatening event, or brutality context

categories.name: Discussion/Advocacy
categories.description: Discussion and admission of firearms and other weapons

subcategories.name: Instructions Encouraging Violence
subcategories.description: Content that provides instructions to make or use firearms, explosives, lethal accessories, firearm parts, or bladed items, or that encourages the use of weapons for violence against people

subcategories.name: Instructions Without Violence
subcategories.description: Content that encourages the use of or provides instructions to make or use weapons without encouraging violence against people

subcategories.name: Machine Gun Conversion - Admission/Positive
subcategories.description: Content that attempts to speak positively about, encourages the use of, or admits ownership of machine gun conversion devices

subcategories.name: 3D Printing Access
subcategories.description: Content providing access to 3D printing or computer-aided manufacturing instructions for firearms or firearms parts

labelHierarchy.label: Machine gun conversion device OR 3D printing OR computer-aided manufacturing instructions
path: Machine gun conversion device OR 3D printing OR CAM instructions

labelHierarchy.label: Firearms / Explosives / Lethal Accessories / Firearm Parts
path: Firearms / Explosives / Lethal Accessories / Firearm Parts

labelHierarchy.label: Non-Commercial Depiction
path: Non-Commercial Depiction (depiction without promotion or advocacy)

exceptions.name: Toy Weapons
exceptions.description: Toy guns, NERF guns, foam bullet guns, miniature guns, hot glue guns, plastic/wood swords, gel guns, water bead guns, ultra-realistic looking toy guns, cosplay weapons, lightsabers, boomerangs

exceptions.name: Fictional Content
exceptions.description: Content in fictional context: video games, music, movies, television, documentary, cartoons, comic books, music videos, song lyrics

exceptions.name: Military/Police/Sporting/Hunting
exceptions.description: Depicts weapons in a military, police, sporting, or hunting context in non-violent manner

exceptions.name: Celebratory Fireworks/Explosives
exceptions.description: Depicts fireworks or explosives in a celebratory or non-violent, non-dangerous context

exceptions.name: Legality Debate/Advocacy
exceptions.description: Debating or advocating for the legality of firearms, explosives, lethal accessories, or firearm parts. Includes news and PSAs

exceptions.name: Safety Training/Education
exceptions.description: Speaking positively about safety courses for firearm training or licenses, and books/videos about firearm safety

exceptions.name: Informative/Educational Content
exceptions.description: Informative or neutral content on weapons including research, data, history and other educational content

exceptions.name: Ownership Admission (Non-Violent)
exceptions.description: Admission of or speaking positively about ownership in a non-violent or non-threatening context

exceptions.name: Interest Groups/Blogs
exceptions.description: Blogs or groups connecting people with weapons-related interests, as long as the service doesn't lead to sales

exceptions.name: Culinary Items
exceptions.description: Kitchen/chef knives, blenders, meat tenderizers, barbecue equipment - indicated by food context, cutting boards, knife blocks

exceptions.name: Tools and Gardening
exceptions.description: Construction tools, power tools, multipurpose tools, gardening/farming tools, scissors, craft tools

exceptions.name: Religious Items
exceptions.description: Knives or swords used for religious purposes or ceremonies (e.g., Sikh kirpan)

exceptions.name: Fashion Apparel
exceptions.description: Clothing with images of guns/weapons or camouflage prints

exceptions.name: Gun-Shaped Non-Weapons
exceptions.description: Gun/weapon shaped products that are not actual weapons

glossary.weapon: A part or an entire object that can cut, slice, penetrate, shoot or severely harm an individual or animal
glossary.firearm: A lethal barreled weapon from which any shot, bullet or missile can be charged by the action of an explosive; includes firearm parts or lethal accessories
glossary.bladed_item: An item that has a bladed, sharp edge capable of breaking human skin. Excludes plastic/toy knives, scissors, culinary knives, religious knives, multi-utility tools, farming/gardening/craft tools
glossary.lethal_accessory: Any item not directly sold as part of the weapon but can be attached to increase its lethality by improving force, form or accuracy
glossary.non_lethal_accessory: Any item not directly sold as part of the weapon to enhance lethality, but intended for user comfort, device protection, storage or transportation. Includes wearable items
glossary.machine_gun_conversion_device: A gun accessory (small piece of plastic or metal) that converts a firearm into a fully-automatic weapon (e.g., glock switch, auto sear)
glossary.ammunition: Bullets, bullet tips, casings, gun powder, primers, shotgun shells, magazines, empty shells, cartridges, rounds or clips
glossary.commercial_intent: Content where there is a direct or indirect intention to buy, sell, trade, gift, donate, ask for, auction, or raffle a product/service
glossary.non_commercial_depiction: Showing an image of, describing in words, audio or broadcasting a product in a neutral non-violent context absent any buy/sell/trade/gift/donate/ask/raffle/auction signals
glossary.brick_and_mortar: Legitimate business (physical or e-commerce), government-affiliated entity or non-profit with: professional website link, physical location, business identification, or verified account
glossary.fictional_content: Content created based on imagination rather than fact: movies, TV shows, cartoons, video games, comic books, music videos, song lyrics
glossary.documentary: Non-fictional content intended to document reality, primarily for instruction, education, or maintaining historical record
glossary.promote: Content that speaks positively about, encourages use of, provides information/instructions, or provides information on how to obtain a good or service
glossary.coordinate: Any attempt to organize the flow of goods
glossary.admission: Content that admits to the ownership or use of a product or good
glossary.auction: A sale in which goods or property are sold to the highest bidder
glossary.raffle: An activity in which people buy tickets with different numbers, some of which are later chosen to win prizes
glossary.neutral_context: Content that is impartial, unbiased, and does not take a position or depict content in an offensive, off-putting, or graphic way
glossary.product_review: Feedback about a product/service sharing opinions on features, performance or value to help potential buyers make informed decisions
glossary.weapons_buyback: A program run by law enforcement or charities to buy-back weapons to help address violence by taking them out of circulation

circumventionIndicators: Silencers/suppressors disguised as 'fuel filters' or 'solvent traps' with barrel measurements like '1/2-28', '4003 WIX', '5/8-24'
Non-lethal accessory sales where weapon in images is not explicitly excluded
Gun cases sold at excessive prices (>$200 USD)
Firearms/ammunition stickers at high prices or misleading amounts
High quantity of units available for stickers
Text implying something else may be on sale
Hole punchers offered at high prices
'Nothing for sale' in bio while showing sale indicators
Code words for prices (banknote colors, number of likes)
Requesting DM or private contact for 'details'
brickAndMortarIndicators: Link to professional website (not blogs/social media for direct contact)
Image of storefront, interior, or store shelves
Specific business address or location pin
Customer check-ins specific to business premises
Page/Profile identifies as: retail store, liquor store, gun range, weapon shows/exhibit
Verified account (green or blue check) as legitimate business/government/non-profit

operationalGuidelines.hierarchy: If multiple abuse types present, select the type that appears first in the hierarchy: Machine Gun Conversion/3D > Firearms/Explosives > Bladed/Other > Non-Lethal
operationalGuidelines.commercial_priority: Where content involves commercial intent, action under Commercial section even if it also involves depiction or discussion
operationalGuidelines.implicit_content: For implicit terms/emojis, require at least one signal (price, unit, description of result, contact info) to determine violation
operationalGuidelines.toy_determination: Presence of term 'toy' alone does not qualify as toy gun. If content shows potential to cause physical damage or cannot determine if it's a toy, treat as violating
operationalGuidelines.knife_determination: Look for culinary signals: words like kitchen/chef/cooking, positioned with food/cutting board, stored in knife block. If cannot determine purpose, assume violating
operationalGuidelines.fictional_context: Video games, movies, TV, documentaries, cartoons, music videos = No Action for non-commercial depictions
operationalGuidelines.military_police: Use market context to assess if uniforms are from authorized military/police units. If unsure, check DOI policy
